objects.name: hexed noodle
objects.description: Android variant of AppleSeed backdoor that masquerades as a (South) Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA) mobile security app and performs execution of shell commands as well as collection of filesystem contents and SMS messages.

objects.name: appleseed
objects.description: Windows backdoor malware that Hexed Noodle is a variant of.

objects.name: KISA
objects.description: Korean Internet Security Agency, whose mobile security app Hexed Noodle masquerades as.

objects.name: Operation Cobra Venom
objects.description: The operation in 2019 where the Windows AppleSeed backdoor was used, and which Hexed Noodle is a variant of.

objects.name: CVE-2021-44228
objects.description: No description available in the report for this CVE.

objects.name: dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Plaintext strings from a Hexed Noodle 'classes.dex' file"
        hash = "a9ff1ebb548f5bba600d38e709ff331749fa9971"

    strings:
        $exfil1 = "multipart/form-data; boundary=$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$
"
        $exfil2 = "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"binary\"; filename=\"
"
        $reqFormatAParam1 = /\?m=[a-d]&p1=/
        $reqFormatAParam2 = /&p2=[a-c]/
        $smsdb = "slist.ldb" //"flist.ldb" (name of the files db) is obfuscated but the developers have forgotten to wrap this sms database filename

    condition:
        3 of them
}

objects.name: T1444
objects.description: Hexed Noodle masquerades as a KISA mobile security app

objects.name: T1592.001
objects.description: Hexed Noodle beacons contain device hardware information and phone number

objects.name: T1059.004
objects.description: Hexed Noodle system commands are executed by passing them to ‘sh -c’

objects.name: T1204.002
objects.description: The user is required to install the Hexed Noodle APK, accept permissions and launch the app

objects.name: T1402
objects.description: Hexed Noodle subscribes to BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED and PACKAGE_INSTALL broadcasts

objects.name: T1547
objects.description: The Hexed Noodle app starts on receipt of the BOOT_COMPLETED notification

objects.name: T1406
objects.description: Hexed Noodle configuration is stored in the app as hex encoded strings containing a 16 byte XOR-key prefix

objects.name: T1560.002
objects.description: Hexed Noodle data is Zip compressed before encryption using standard libraries

objects.name: T1005
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects SMS messages and certain filesystem documents

objects.name: T1119
objects.description: Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents

objects.name: T1412
objects.description: Hexed Noodle regularly scans file and SMS directories for changes to trigger exfiltration

objects.name: T1420
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects both stored and incoming SMS messages, possibly enabling the bypass of SMS-based two-factor authentication

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uses HTTP requests for tasking and exfiltration

objects.name: T1030
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uploads files in chunks of at most 10MB

objects.name: T1041
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltration and tasking are HTTP POST requests to the same server with different parameters

objects.name: T1532
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrated data is encrypted, prepended with the 16 byte XOR key and Hex encoded

objects.name: T1437
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrates data using HTTP POST requests

objects.name: T1582
objects.description: Hexed Noodle enables the operator to send SMS messages from the victim device

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Hexed Noodle
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. hexed noodle.
